title: Designing University English Education Using Integrated Problem-Based Learning (IPBL)

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Focuses on cultivating English proficiency centered on real-life problem-solving, implementing interactive learning environments combining online/offline activities

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real social issues (e.g., global challenges, campus problems) in English and present solutions in a 3-minute presentation.
Learners can revise English report drafts at least twice based on peer feedback during team-based problem-solving and finalize a 500-word report.
Learners can write critical-thinking-based English comments at least twice weekly on online discussion platforms and provide feedback on peers’ posts at least once.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
